alert.note: Alert for Clay; De Kalb; Jackson; Macon; Putnam; Smith; Wilson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 2:27PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Smith, northwestern De Kalb, western Jackson, southeastern Wilson, west central Clay, southeastern Macon and west central Putnam Counties through 300 PM CDT... At 226 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Red Boiling Springs to Auburntown. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Smithville, Carthage, Gainesboro, Gordonsville, Red Boiling Springs, Hickman, South Carthage, Alexandria, Dowelltown, Liberty, Auburntown, Whitleyville, Pleasant Shade, Center Hill Lake, Granville and Edgar Evans State Park. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 253 and 272. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Clay; De Kalb; Jackson; Macon; Putnam; Smith; Wilson
